name: Modular Synthesis 6
description:
(2021)
By ClockworkFeathers

Animated edit of a photo of a composition consisting of components made using silvered furnace blown glass, 3D printed ceramics, flameworked soda lime glass, and seed beads. 

All objects and images used to compose this work were produced by ClockworkFeathers unless otherwise attributed.

******** ******** ******** ******** ******** ******** ********

there is something in the noise
A pattern
A pulse
A beat

something is pushing through
A sign
A signal
A summons

in this primordial melange, 
things will arise in the blink of an eye 
and dissipate just as quickly.

Marvelous sparks flicker in and fade out like knowing winks 
to those fortunate enough to bear witness to the moment, 
to those changed by the experience
to those caught up in the waves 
     rippling out from that singularity
caught up in its gravity yet propagating 
     the effects of its existence

Will you be a part of this happening?
Will you embrace the possibility of wonder, 
whether it be a fleeting flare for an instant
or a spark that lights an inferno

something is emerging; will you 
herald its coming?
join its journey?
welcome its arrival?

Will you be one who can claim 
to have been there;
who is etched in the indelible 
ledger of its history

******** ******** ******** ******** ******** ******** ********

We react to our surroundings, and our surroundings react back. Adaptation is a cycle; a continuous exchange of back and forth. Sometimes it’s a fight, and sometimes it’s a conversation. Often times, it’s a bit of both. 

The exchanges make us. It shapes us and pushes us, as we push back. If we are clever, we learn and improve. We probe and test to understand, so that we can be more intentional in our interactions. We start to recognize patterns, and to predict the ebb and flow of our environment. 

This is all a part of the process. It builds upon what came before and provides a place to be built upon. We are only ever one step into the journey to come. We are never assured that we will reach our intended destination, even when the destination isn’t the point. But that’s a part of why we journey.
